name: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A rich and savory meat sauce served over spaghetti.
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
Sauté chopped onion, carrot, and celery in olive oil until softened.
Add ground beef and cook until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in garlic, tomato paste, oregano, and basil. Cook for 1 minute.
Add crushed tomatoes, red wine (if using), and beef broth. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and cook for at least 30 minutes (longer is better), stirring occasionally.
Serve sauce over spaghetti, topped with Parmesan cheese.

name: Simple Chicken Stir-fry
description: A quick and easy chicken and vegetable stir-fry with a savory sauce.
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Toss with 1 tbsp soy sauce and 1 tsp cornstarch.
Prepare vegetables: chop broccoli, slice bell pepper, julienne carrot.
In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, minced ginger, and minced garlic for the sauce.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through. Remove from wok.
Add vegetables to the wok and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return chicken to the wok. Pour sauce over everything and stir to combine.
Cook for another 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens slightly.
Serve hot over rice.

name: Vegetarian Lentil Soup
description: A hearty and nutritious soup made with lentils and vegetables.
instructions: Rinse lentils thoroughly.
Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven. Sauté chopped onion, carrot, and celery until softened (about 5-7 minutes).
Add minced garlic, cumin, coriander, and turmeric. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in lentils, vegetable broth, and diced tomatoes (undrained).
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
If using spinach, stir it in during the last 5 minutes of cooking until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with a squeeze of lemon juice.

name: Classic Beef Tacos
description: Seasoned ground beef served in taco shells with your favorite toppings.
instructions: Cook ground beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in taco seasoning mix and water (according to seasoning package directions).
Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until sauce has thickened slightly.
Warm taco shells or tortillas according to package directions.
Assemble tacos: fill shells with seasoned beef, then add lettuce, tomato, cheese, and other desired toppings.

name: Caprese Salad
description: A simple Italian salad made with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil.
instructions: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella into 1/4-inch thick rounds.
Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a platter, alternating and overlapping them.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices.
Drizzle generously with extra virgin olive oil.
If using, drizzle with balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

name: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
description: A whole chicken roasted to perfection with lemon and herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Rinse chicken and pat dry with paper towels.
Cut one lemon in half. Squeeze juice from one half over the chicken. Cut the other half into wedges.
Stuff the chicken cavity with lemon wedges, a few garlic cloves (smashed), rosemary sprigs, and thyme sprigs.
Rub the outside of the chicken with olive oil. Season generously with salt and pepper.
Place chicken in a roasting pan. Scatter remaining garlic cloves around the chicken.
Roast for 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the thigh.
Let chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving.

name: Quick Shrimp Scampi
description: Shrimp sautéed with garlic, white wine, lemon juice, and butter, often served over pasta.
instructions: Cook linguine according to package directions. Reserve about 1/2 cup of pasta water.
While pasta cooks, heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes (if using). Cook for 1 minute until fragrant (do not brown garlic).
Add shrimp to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until pink and opaque.
Pour in white wine and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer and cook for 1-2 minutes, allowing the sauce to reduce slightly.
Add cooked pasta to the skillet along with a splash of the reserved pasta water if the sauce is too thick.
Stir in chopped fresh parsley.
Serve immediately, perhaps with extra lemon wedges.

name: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
description: Flaky salmon fillets baked alongside tender asparagus spears.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Toss asparagus with 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread in a single layer on one side of the baking sheet.
Pat salmon fillets dry. Place on the other side of the baking sheet.
Drizzle salmon with olive oil. Season with garlic powder, dill, salt, and pepper.
Slice lemon thinly and place a few slices on top of each salmon fillet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork, and asparagus is tender-crisp.
Cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of the salmon.

name: Pancakes
description: Fluffy American-style pancakes, perfect for breakfast or brunch.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined (a few lumps are okay). Do not overmix.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium heat.
Pour or scoop about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the griddle.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Bubbles will appear on the surface when ready to flip.
Serve warm with butter and maple syrup.

name: Guacamole
description: A classic creamy avocado dip with lime, onion, and cilantro.
instructions: Cut avocados in half, remove pits, and scoop flesh into a medium bowl.
Mash avocado with a fork to desired consistency (chunky or smooth).
Add lime juice, chopped red onion, minced jalapeño (if using), and chopped cilantro.
Season with salt and cumin (if using). Stir to combine.
If using diced tomato, gently fold it in.
Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary (more lime juice, salt, etc.).
Serve immediately with tortilla chips or as a topping.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
description: Grilled chicken breast and crisp romaine lettuce tossed in Caesar dressing.
instructions: Season chicken breast with salt, pepper, and a little olive oil.
Grill or pan-sear chicken until cooked through. Let rest, then slice or dice.
Wash and chop romaine lettuce. Place in a large bowl.
Add cooked chicken, croutons, and Parmesan cheese to the lettuce.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

name: Beef Chili
description: A hearty and flavorful chili made with ground beef, beans, and spices.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add ground beef, onion, and bell pepper. Cook until beef is browned and vegetables are softened. Drain excess fat.
Stir in minced garlic, chili powder, cumin, oregano, and cayenne (if using). Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add diced tomatoes, kidney beans, pinto beans, and beef broth. Stir to combine.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for at least 1 hour (2-3 hours is even better), stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, topped with shredded cheese and sour cream if desired.

name: Mushroom Risotto
description: Creamy Italian rice dish cooked with mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.
instructions: Heat olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add mushrooms and cook until browned and their liquid has evaporated. Remove mushrooms and set aside.
Add a little more olive oil if needed. Add chopped onion and cook until softened (about 5 minutes).
Add Arborio rice and minced garlic. Toast for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until grains are translucent at the edges.
Pour in white wine and cook, stirring, until it's fully absorbed.
Add a ladleful of warm broth to the rice, stirring continuously until absorbed.
Continue adding broth, one ladleful at a time, waiting until each is absorbed before adding the next. Stir constantly. This process should take about 20-25 minutes.
When the rice is al dente (cooked through but with a slight bite) and the risotto is creamy, stir in the cooked mushrooms, remaining butter, and grated Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in chopped parsley.
Serve immediately.

name: Greek Salad
description: A refreshing salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, feta, and a lemon-oregano dressing.
instructions: Chop cucumbers, tomatoes, and green bell pepper into bite-sized pieces.
Thinly slice red onion.
Combine chopped vegetables and sliced onion in a large bowl.
Add Kalamata olives.
Crumble feta cheese over the salad.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, and dried oregano. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately or chill for later (dressing may make cucumbers softer over time).

name: Omelette
description: A simple and customizable egg omelette.
ingredients: fillings (optional: cheese, ham, mushrooms, onions, peppers)
instructions: Crack eggs into a bowl. Add a splash of milk or water, salt, and pepper. Whisk well until smooth and slightly frothy.
If using fillings, prepare them (e.g., chop vegetables, grate cheese). Sauté any raw vegetables if desired.
Heat butter or oil in a non-stick skillet (8-10 inch) over medium heat until butter is melted and foamy.
Pour egg mixture into the hot skillet. Let it set for about 30-60 seconds without stirring.
Gently push cooked egg from the edges toward the center, tilting the pan to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath.
Continue until most of the egg is set but still slightly wet on top.
If using fillings, sprinkle them over one half of the omelette.
Fold the other half of the omelette over the fillings. Cook for another minute, or until cheese is melted (if using).
Slide omelette onto a plate and serve immediately.

name: Shepherd's Pie
description: A comforting casserole of ground meat and vegetables topped with mashed potatoes.
instructions: Peel and chop potatoes. Boil in salted water until tender. Drain, then mash with butter and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add ground meat and cook until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add onion, carrot, and celery. Cook until softened (about 5-7 minutes).
Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, and rosemary (if using).
Gradually stir in beef broth. Bring to a simmer and cook until sauce thickens slightly (about 5-10 minutes).
Stir in frozen peas and corn. Season filling with salt and pepper to taste.
If your skillet isn't oven-safe, transfer the meat mixture to a baking dish.
Top the meat mixture evenly with the mashed potatoes. Roughen the surface with a fork.
If desired, sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese over the potatoes.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.

name: Tuna Salad Sandwich
description: A classic sandwich filling made with canned tuna and mayonnaise.
ingredients: canned tuna (in water or oil, drained)
instructions: In a medium bowl, flake the drained tuna with a fork.
Add mayonnaise, chopped celery, and red onion (if using).
Stir in lemon juice and Dijon mustard (if using).
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix well to combine.
Serve tuna salad on bread slices, with lettuce if desired.

name: Fried Rice
description: A versatile dish made with leftover cooked rice, vegetables, egg, and protein.
ingredients: protein (optional: cooked chicken, shrimp, tofu, ham, diced)
instructions: Lightly beat eggs with a pinch of salt. Heat 1 tsp vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Pour in eggs and cook, scrambling gently, until just set. Remove from wok and set aside. Chop roughly.
Add 1-2 tbsp vegetable oil to the wok. Add onion, carrot, garlic, and ginger (if using). Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until fragrant and slightly softened.
Add chilled cooked rice to the wok. Break up any clumps with a spatula. Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, tossing frequently, until rice is heated through.
Add frozen peas and your choice of protein (if using). Stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Push rice to one side of the wok. Add soy sauce and sesame oil to the empty side, let it sizzle for a few seconds, then mix everything together.
Stir in the cooked scrambled eggs.
Taste and add more soy sauce if needed. Serve hot.

name: Tomato Soup (Creamy)
description: A smooth and creamy tomato soup, perfect with grilled cheese.
ingredients: canned crushed tomatoes (or whole peeled, blended)
heavy cream (or milk for lighter version)
instructions: Heat butter and olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and cook until softened (about 5 minutes). Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Stir in crushed tomatoes and vegetable broth. Add a pinch of sugar and dried basil.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Carefully transfer soup to a blender (or use an immersion blender) and blend until smooth. If using a standard blender, do this in batches and be cautious with hot liquids.
Return soup to the pot. Stir in heavy cream (or milk).
Heat gently but do not boil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil if desired.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic chewy chocolate chip cookies.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar with an electric mixer until creamy.
Beat in egg and vanilla extract.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing on low speed until just combined. Do not overmix.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets, about 2 inches apart.
Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until edges are golden brown and centers are set.
Let cookies cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

name: Simple Green Salad with Vinaigrette
description: A basic green salad with a classic oil and vinegar dressing.
ingredients: red wine vinegar (or white wine vinegar)
instructions: Wash and dry mixed greens. If using, prepare other vegetables (tomatoes, cucumber, carrot) and add to a large salad bowl.
In a small bowl or jar, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, and Dijon mustard (if using).
Season vinaigrette with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour dressing over the salad greens just before serving. Toss gently to coat.
Serve immediately.
